title: [Large-Scale] Instructional Design Process for Enhancing Mathematical Understanding and Computational Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic mathematical concepts and basic interest in programming
context.additional_context: Strengthening mathematical problem-solving competencies linked to social studies curricula for pre-service and in-service teachers.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the process of solving real-life problems using mathematical models and computational approaches.

Learners enhance their ability to transform abstract mathematical concepts into computational thinking (e.g., loops, conditionals) using embodied activities (e.g., physical manipulation, simulations).
Learners produce computational problem-solving prototypes incorporating peer feedback through LMS-based collaborative activities at least three times.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
